Package gameLogic

Class Combat

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
gameLogic.Combat
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Combat extends Thread
Version:
Last refactored on 13.06.2022

Combat class facilitates the interactions caused by Main Character and some enemy monster occupying the same room on the gameMap.

In general terms. Scanner object is passed from the main class to process input, and further actions are invoked based on the input

Author:
Martin Kadlec

  • Method Details

    • encounter

      public static void encounter(Scanner input)
      Encounter method provides the framework for the turn based combat of the game. On even turns, player is asked to provide input based on selected set of commands. Generally, this will invoke some sort of method from knight package On odd turns, monster attackPattern method will be invoked. Encounter also uses Random object to generate "dice rolls" to make combat more dynamic.
      Parameters:
      input - Scanner object passed from the main class.
      See Also:
      • TheKnight
      • TheKnight.resolveAttack(int, Monster)
      • HostileActions

    • validateValues

      public static boolean validateValues(Monster enemyPresent)
      Method is invoked from the encounter method.
      Parameters:
      enemyPresent - reference to the monster instance which is currently engaged in combat
      Returns:
      true if the fight should continue, false if the fight should be over
      See Also:
      • Checks the health stats on both static reference the Knight and currently fought monster. Returns boolean flag for use in branching logic.
      • Monster
      • TheKnight
